metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0236 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in WordPress before 3.5.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving (1) gallery shortcodes or (2) the content of a post.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.1+dfsg-2').
